action.action-desc: Mr. Allen introduced the following bill; which was referred to the Committee on Education and Labor

form.official-title: To amend the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act to authorize a study to review specific outcomes of entrepreneurial skills development programs, and for other purposes.

section.text: Section 101(d)(3)(D) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3111(d)(3)(D)) is amended—

paragraph.text: by striking and jobseekers and inserting jobseekers, and entrepreneurs; and
by inserting and entrepreneurial skills development and microenterprise services after occupations.

section.header: Identification of eligible providers of training services
section.text: Section 122(a)(2)(C) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3152(a)(2)(C)) is amended by inserting and providers of entrepreneurial skills development programs after organizations.

section.header: Required local employment and training activities
section.text: Section 134(c)(2)(A) of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3174(c)(2)(A)) is amended—

clause.text: in item (aa), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

item.text: provision of information on entrepreneurship, as appropriate; and

subparagraph.text: in subclause (II), by adding and after the semicolon; and
by adding at the end the following:

subclause.text: referral to microenterprise services, as appropriate;

subparagraph.text: in subclause (I), by inserting , which may include resources to support entrepreneurship, after listings; and
in subclause (III), by inserting , which may include entrepreneurship opportunities, after demand; and

paragraph.text: in clause (xiii), by inserting or entrepreneurial opportunities after workplace.

section.text: Section 169 of the Workforce Innovation and Opportunity Act (29 U.S.C. 3224) is amended—

clause.text: by redesignating subparagraph (K) as subparagraph (L); and
by inserting after subparagraph (J) the following:

subparagraph.header: Study on entrepreneurial skills development programs
subparagraph.text: The Secretary shall, through a grant or contract, conduct a three-year multistate study on entrepreneurial skills development programs, which shall include the following:

subclause.text: successful practices for developing entrepreneurial skills of individuals;
evidence-based and other best practices for mentoring potential entrepreneurs;
the qualifications needed for skills development providers to successfully develop the entrepreneurial skills of individuals;
strategies for engaging employers and other private sector partners;
such program outcomes that correlate with entrepreneurial success;
how such programs successfully measure the progress of participants in such programs;
the extent to which such programs lead to industry recognized credentials;
the impact, including the economic impact, of such programs on States and local communities;
the extent to which such programs affect business development and job creation in States and local communities;
how such programs identify potential program participants’ readiness for the program; and
the average earnings of participants who complete such a program three years after the date of completion of such program.

clause.text: Recommendations for States and local communities to expand access to such programs.

subparagraph.text: in paragraph (5)(A), by inserting which shall include individuals pursuing entrepreneurship, after particular service populations,; and

paragraph.text: in subsection (c), by striking the third sentence and inserting the following: Such projects may include demonstration and pilot projects relating to promoting self-employment, promoting entrepreneurship, promoting job creation (especially for in-demand industry sectors or occupations), averting dislocations, assisting dislocated farmers, assisting dislocated fishermen, developing career pathways and encouraging advancements, and promoting public works..
